The Courseware Accessibility Study

Distance Education Survey Results

The seven participants have collectively substantial experience with courses  delivered in a variety of formats.  They were most interested in taking courses involving computers compared to other formats (rating mean 5.6 compared to about 3 for other formats).  The most popular reasons for taking courses were for personal interest and for professional upgrading.  On average they devoted about a day a week on their continuing education studies in addition to working.  About half were employed full-time and half part-time (average 29 hours pre week). The survey responses are indicated below enclosed in brackets [ ] along with the mean response where appropriate.

(CCE and EvNet)

[HOME] [Back to Appendix]

Part D: Employment and Education

We are interested in your experiences with education and employment. In the following 10 questions please select the choice that best describes you or your experiences, and fill in the blank spaces where they are provided.

Enter your Participant ID

1. What types of post-secondary courses have you taken anywhere? (Indicate Yes or No for each type.)
No [3]Yes Print-based correspondence, if yes then how many?  [mean 2.3]
No [5]Yes Evening Lecture course, if yes then how many?  [mean 12]
No [3]Yes Block course (2 to 5 full days), if yes then how many? [mean 7.7]
No [4]Yes A course which uses computers in the delivery of any of its contents, if yes then how many? [mean 6.5]
